intro: Kuhnia eupatorioides var. ozarkana, commonly known as the Ozark ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It features tall, erect stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, purple to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to moist, well-drained soils. This variety is often found in woodland edges and open wetlands, showcasing its preference for humid environments.
